common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various integration problems between Pieces OS and Desktop App, including dependency connection failures, Ollama installation issues, and account linking errors.  Proposed solutions involve checking log files, restarting apps, and verifying installation methods.  Support teams offer video calls for troubleshooting and are actively investigating the issues.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User, mariusz-kowalski, reported an error when opening Pieces Desktop App.
* This issue might be related to specific Linux machines.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific cause of the error is unknown.
* It's unclear if this is a general issue or a specific problem to the user's machine.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support team requested the user's log file for analysis.
* Offered a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User provided the log file.
* Video call declined by the user.
* Investigation ongoing.

**Additional Information:**

* The conversation took place on February 24, 2025.
* Similar issues have been reported through other support channels.
* The user was directed to relevant resources within the Pieces App support system.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User [@waseem852](https://github.com/waseem852) experienced issues with Ollama integration in Pieces.
* Ollama failed to install and run even after various attempts including installation via Pieces, winget, and after restarting both Pieces apps.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failure regardless of the method used.
* Ollama failed to run with Pieces.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Checking whether Ollama was installed manually or via Pieces.
* Restarting Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop.
* Checking if both Pieces apps were shut down after uninstalling Ollama.
* Scheduling a call to debug the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A call was scheduled to further investigate and resolve the issue.
* The outcome of the call and the final resolution are not documented in this conversation thread.

**Important Notes:**

* This summary focuses on the core information and may not include all details from the conversation.
* The user's issue remains unresolved as of the provided conversation.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User, johnkennyuk, experiences issues with account linking.
* Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months.
* Not working as expected.
* Unable to launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not user-friendly.
* Separate accounts created due to bug in earlier versions.
* Inconsistency in email capitalization causing linking issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* New account linking flow planned for mid-to-late February.
* Temporary workaround by merging accounts through Pieces support.
* Email capitalization discrepancy identified and addressed.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* New account linking system development in progress, expected early/mid March.
* User's GitHub account reset for further attempts.
* User to wait for new system implementation.

**Additional Notes:**

* User's domain email linked to Google account.
* User's GitHub account needs email privacy setting disabled.
* User's capital letter in email causing inconsistency.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users reported problems with Ollama installation and integration within Pieces OS. These include Cuda errors, installation failures, and conflicts between Pieces OS and standalone Ollama installations. Proposed solutions involved reinstalling Ollama, ensuring a clean installation, and addressing potential race conditions. Pieces OS updates aim to resolve these issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk experienced issues with Ollama in Pieces OS, specifically Cuda errors related to the `cublas64_12.dll`.
* The issue seemed to be related to a corrupted installation of either Ollama or Pieces OS, with Ollama failing to work unless manually restarted.
* After multiple uninstalls and reinstalls, the issue resolved itself inexplicably.

**Problems Identified:**

* Multiple installations of Ollama caused conflicts.
* Ollama installation via Pieces OS potentially incomplete or broken.
* Race condition between Pieces OS and Ollama startup causing issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama using the official installer.
* Cleaning up system paths and uninstalling through PowerShell.
* Implementing a fix in Pieces OS version 11.1.2 to address the race condition.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for Johnkennyuk, but further monitoring is required.
* Brian-at-pieces is available for further assistance if the issue reoccurs.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of using the official Ollama installer and ensuring a clean installation.
* It also demonstrates the potential for race conditions between applications, requiring careful handling.

**Overall:**

The issue seems to have been resolved with the help of Brian-at-pieces, but further monitoring and potential updates to Pieces OS may be necessary.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Bugs and Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including horizontal scrolling problems in code snippets, cursor visibility issues in the Copilot chat window, and difficulties linking multiple accounts. Proposed solutions include UI/UX improvements, bug fixes in upcoming releases, and account merging assistance from the Pieces support team.

related_issues.title: Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
related_issues.text:
Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Horizontal scroll within a code snippet from copilot answer is buggy. I cannot scroll horizontally back and forth to see full line. I need to select text to reach end of line. Once release, my cursor wont appear to scroll left again. Horizontal scrollbar doesn't respond and I cannot select text to left. cursor changes to a drag and drop cursor.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User reported an issue with the cursor not hiding when typing in the Copilot chat window.
* Support bot provided links to related issues and helpful resources.
* Pieces team members acknowledged the issue and assigned it to the appropriate team.
* Mack, a Pieces team member, confirmed the issue and promised to investigate it for an upcoming release.

**Problems Identified:**

* The cursor stays visible when typing in the Copilot chat window, which can be distracting and interfere with user experience.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* The Pieces team will investigate the issue and implement a fix for an upcoming release.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is being investigated by the Pieces team.
* A fix is expected to be included in an upcoming release.

**Outcome:**

* The user's feedback was acknowledged and appreciated.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a solution to the reported issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* Based on the issue timeline, a fix might be available by November 2023.

related_issues.title: Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window
related_issues.text:
Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When initially beginning to type a question in the text field in Copilot, the mouse cursor/pointer will not hide and obstructs the text. I can't capture it in a screenshot, but the attachment should hopefully show a brief screen recording of the issue.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e4e60bb-a8a2-49cd-92a5-35a49b2a63db
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* GeoMod reported an issue regarding expected behavior in Pieces.
* The issue was automatically routed to the appropriate team member.
* Mack (Pieces support staff) confirmed understanding of the issue and expressed willingness to address it in a future release.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific problem GeoMod encountered was not explicitly stated in the conversation. 
* However, it is implied that the reported issue was related to expected behavior in the Pieces app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack indicated that the Pieces team would consider supporting the reported behavior in a future release.
* No specific solution was mentioned in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being considered for a future release.
* The outcome of this consideration is not yet known.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation timeframe is February 24, 2025. 
* No further updates or comments were provided in the conversation excerpt.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User, johnkennyuk, experiences issues with account linking.
* Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months.
* Not working as expected.
* Unable to launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not user-friendly.
* Separate accounts created due to bug in earlier versions.
* Inconsistency in email capitalization causing linking issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* New account linking flow planned for mid-to-late February.
* Temporary workaround by merging accounts through Pieces support.
* Email capitalization discrepancy identified and addressed.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* New account linking system development in progress, expected early/mid March.
* User's GitHub account reset for further attempts.
* User to wait for new system implementation.

**Additional Notes:**

* User's domain email linked to Google account.
* User's GitHub account needs email privacy setting disabled.
* User's capital letter in email causing inconsistency.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring issues related to Ollama installation, integration, and conflicts with Pieces OS.  This includes addressing Cuda errors, installation failures, and potential race conditions.

**Improve Pieces OS and Desktop App Integration:** Focus on resolving integration problems between Pieces OS and the Desktop App, such as dependency connection failures, Ollama installation issues, and account linking errors.  Improve documentation and troubleshooting guides for these issues.

**Address Pieces Desktop App Bugs:** Dedicate resources to fix reported bugs in the Desktop App, including horizontal scrolling problems in code snippets, cursor visibility issues in the Copilot chat window, and difficulties linking multiple accounts.

**Enhance Account Linking Functionality:** Review and improve the account linking process to ensure users can easily link multiple accounts without encountering issues.  This may involve redesigning the linking flow and addressing email capitalization inconsistencies.

**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about the status of reported issues, especially those with high activity levels. Provide clear timelines for bug fixes and feature updates related to Ollama integration and account linking.
